intro: Piper cajamarcanum, commonly known as the Peruvian pepper or *piper cajamarcanum*, is a climbing vine native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes many pepper species. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into elongated, aromatic berries. The berries contain small, black seeds and are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological contexts.
